availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William W. Cardwell (Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Nancy Cardwell. Father of Thomas L. Cardwell, David E. Cardwell, and Cordelia Cardwell. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Madisonville in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Madisonville in 1860. Member of the Hopkins County Christian Church in Madisonville.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 50B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 242-43.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 25.
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 767.
"W. W. Cardwell (May 31, 1822-May 26, 1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #66862292, accessed March 23, 2017, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/66862292.
